text: José Antonio Name Terán (5 February 1936 – 5 September 2011) was a lawyer and former Senator of Colombia. Considered a Liberal caudillo, he was one of the longest serving senators in Congress and one of the most influential politicians of the Caribbean Region of Colombia. He also served in Colombia as Minister of Labour, Member of the Chamber of Representatives, and a Deputy to the Atlántico Departmental Assembly. In 2007 Name ran for Governor of Atlántico as a Party of the U candidate, obtaining 213,270 votes (28.76% of the total) during the Colombian regional elections, but lost against Eduardo Verano De la Rosa. ==Personal life== He died in Bogotá, D.C., on 5 September 2011 of a prolonged respiratory tract infection. ==See also== * Fuad Ricardo Char Abdala * Roberto Gerlein Echeverría ==References== Category:1936 births Category:2011 deaths Category:People from Sincelejo Category:Colombian people of Lebanese descent Jose Antonio Category:Colombian lawyers Category:Members of the Chamber of Representatives of Colombia Category:Colombian Ministers of Labour and Social Protection Category:Members of the Senate of Colombia Category:Social Party of National Unity politicians
title: José Name Terán
